AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan: a vehicle mentioned as a white sedan, involved in the incident at the Freer immigration checkpoint, lacked a wind farm sticker, designed to hold five people, stopped by Agent Trevino and found to be transporting illegals, registered to Dallas-Fort Worth as a rental vehicle, traveling in tandem with a black Dodge pickup truck, driven by RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR., sped away at around eighty miles per hour, rented from Hertz Dallas-Fort Worth, had two passengers sitting in front and three in back, including two hidden in the trunk, used as a load car
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.black Dodge truck: a black truck with a camper, suspected of being used to transport illegal aliens, lacked a wind farm sticker, believed to be connected to the white Malibu sedan, subject of a BOLO, stopped by Officer Reymundo Reyes for not using a turning signal, registered to Corinth, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.white Malibu sedan and black Dodge truck: vehicles jointly involved in the incident at the Freer immigration checkpoint, with out-of-town registrations, traveling in tandem on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, driven by RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.black Dodge truck and white car: vehicles jointly involved in the incident, with the black Dodge truck following the white car
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.black Dodge pickup truck: a black truck with a camper, suspected of being used to transport illegal aliens, lacked a wind farm sticker, believed to be connected to the white Malibu sedan, subject of a BOLO, stopped by Officer Reymundo Reyes for not using a turning signal, registered to Corinth, Texas, had a dark blue or black camper, was traveling in tandem with the white Malibu sedan on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, used as a lead car
